result.execSummary:
The defendant Wesley J Brice was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Marijuana. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: $100 fine plus costs. (fine and costs have been paid in full)

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Wesley J Brice

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: DC Circuit Court Stipulated Pretrial Disposition - State moves Ct. 1 to County Ordinance Possession of THC, moves to dismiss Ct. 2 but read in. $100 plus costs has been paid in full, no appearance required 4/17/17. Court approves disposition, judgment entered to amended Ct. 1, court dismisses Ct. 2 but reads in for sentencing purposes. Bond is no longer in effect.
Status conference on April 17, 2017 at 09:45 am.

Attorney Eric Steven Maciolek in court.  Colleen Catherine Nordin appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file. Atty Maciolek unsure of defendants whereabouts. State requests bench warrant, has no ojection to court staying the signing of the warrant until noon on Tuesday, 3/14/17. Court orders bench warrant but stays signing it until noon on 3/14/17 to allow Atty Maciolek time to locate defendant and make other arrangements for him to appear.

Defendant Wesley J Brice in court with attorney Eric Steven Maciolek.  Colleen Catherine Nordin appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file. Atty Maciolek indicates defendant needs a little more time to prepay fine/costs. State has no objection. If fine/costs paid in full by next hearing, matter can be disposed by written stipulation and defendant won't need to appear.   Bond remains in effect.  Status conference scheduled for March 10, 2017 at 11:15 am.

Defendant Wesley J Brice in court with attorney Gregory Allen Gerbers.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file. Atty Gerbers requests some time for defendant to prepay fine/costs to take advantage of the State's offer. State has no objection to adjournment. Bond remains in effect.  Status conference scheduled for January 19, 2017 at 11:45 am.

Not to possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription and then only take in the amount and frequency prescribed.  Not to possess or use any drug paraphernalia.  To be fingerprinted and photographed before leaving the Justice Center.

Defendant Wesley J Brice in court with attorney Gregory Allen Gerbers.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Copy of Complaint given to Defendant in Court.  Court reviews charge(s), max. penalties, right to counsel. Defense waives reading of the complaint, enters not guilty plea. Court finds probable cause for bindover. Bond set.  Status conference scheduled for November 11, 2016 at 02:00 pm.
